answers.answer: Many people have low vitamin D levels, as long as they aren't critically low you shouldn't worry. It usually takes a few weeks for your levels to improve, but the supplements will help, as will spending a little time in the sunshine (difficult during the winter) and drinking vitamin D milk.
Its freezin in the uk an we hardly have sunshine anymore. I keep takin vitamin D hope for the best. Thanka for reaponding

question: Well just been told I have low vitamin D. My doc took a test on jan an they give me the results now 4 days away from my due date. How annoying are they.. Well I really wanna know is how will this affect me an my baby. I read that the baby can get diabetes an ashma. Will my baby have bone problems becoz I have low vitamin D?? I am worried I have started takin vitamin D today will it take affect asap. I have also taken another blood test on thursday to check if my iron an vitamin D levels have improved.
title: Low Vitamin D	how does this affect me or my baby???
